progressWeights.description: Minimal market validation with no customer contact or revenue evidence
progressWeights.rationale: No customer interviews, surveys, or market research conducted. Only evidence is a prototype from Lovable platform and general statement that 'pet parents are obsessed' without specific validation
keyAchievements: General market interest indicated ('pet parents are obsessed')
mainGaps: No customer discovery or market research conducted
No revenue validation or paying customers
No market testing or validation experiments

progressWeights.description: Clear problem and solution definition but lacks specific success metrics
progressWeights.rationale: Well-defined problem (dogs have difficulty dating) and solution (Tinder for dogs with location-based matching), but no measurable success criteria or specific target customer segmentation
keyAchievements: Clear problem statement: dogs have difficulty dating
Defined solution approach: location-based dog dating platform
Identified target customers: pet parents and dogs
Clear value proposition: finds 'hot dogs' in the area
mainGaps: No product scope boundaries clearly defined

progressWeights.description: Limited relevant experience with significant skill gaps and resource constraints
progressWeights.rationale: Founder has personal dog ownership experience and furry community knowledge, but lacks business skills, technical capabilities are unclear, and needs significant funding for marketing
keyAchievements: Personal experience as dog owner (direct problem understanding)
mainGaps: Major skill gaps in marketing and funding acquisition
No co-founder or team composition details

progressWeights.description: No business model defined or validated
progressWeights.rationale: No revenue model, pricing strategy, unit economics, or monetization approach specified. No evidence of customer willingness to pay
mainGaps: No unit economics (CAC, LTV, margins unknown)

progressWeights.description: General market interest indicated but no market research or sizing conducted
progressWeights.rationale: Pet parent obsession suggests market potential, but no market size data, trends analysis, or customer segment research provided
keyAchievements: General market interest indicated ('all pet parents are obsessed')
mainGaps: No market size data (TAM, SAM unknown)

progressWeights.description: Basic differentiation but limited competitive analysis
progressWeights.rationale: Specialized focus on dog dating provides some differentiation, but no direct competitor analysis, limited competitive advantages, and no defensible moats identified
keyAchievements: Specialized focus on dog dating (vs general pet services)

tasks.description: Conduct customer discovery interviews with 20+ pet parents
tasks.outcome: Validated problem understanding and customer needs

tasks.description: Test willingness to pay with potential customers
tasks.outcome: Validated pricing model and revenue potential

successCriteria: Pricing model validated with target customers
riskMitigation: Start with existing network of dog owners
Offer free trials to reduce customer risk
Focus on early adopters who are most likely to engage

tasks.description: Define revenue model and pricing strategy
Calculate unit economics and business metrics

riskMitigation: Validate assumptions with real customer data

estimatedTimeToCompletion: 12-18 months to sustainable revenue and product-market fit
criticalPath: Conduct customer discovery to validate problem and demand
Define and validate business model with real customers
Build functional MVP based on customer feedback
Acquire first paying customers to prove product-market fit
Address founder capacity constraints through team building or funding
